newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Ansett has no comment on Diners Club Australia.
newsitem.headline: Ansett has no comment on Diners Club Australia.

text.p: Airline Ansett Australia on Thursday reiterated it was committed to selling non-core assets but declined to comment on reports it was about sell its 68.2 percent stake in Diners Club Australia.
"I really don't have any comment but I can say that our long-term strategy does focus on our core business and the disposal of non-core assets," an Ansett spokeswoman said.
A Sydney Morning Herald report valued Ansett's Diners Club stake at up to A$43 million.

"Ansett has already called for expressions of interest for its stake in Diners Club and it is believed that the cut-off date has expired, with about six parties showing their hand," the newspaper said.
Those parties included Westpac Banking Corp, National Australia Bank Ltd, Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd, Citibank and GE Capital Corp, the Herald said.
Ansett is jointly owned by News Corp Ltd and Air New Zealand Ltd.
Ansett, which is struggling to regain profitability, has said it would sell non-core assets like tourist resorts and the Diners Club stake.
The newspaper said Diners Club would keep its frequent flier programme with Ansett after the stake was sold.
The remaining interest in Diners Club Australia is held by Diners Club International, with 22.7 percent, and by Diners Club Japan, with 9.1 percent.
